Aronofsky"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2921576729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzVmYTdiZjctMDE5NS00M2RlLWIxNTAtYjJmMWE1MmUzOTBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4OTI2MTU@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzVmYTdiZjctMDE5NS00M2RlLWIxNTAtYjJmMWE1MmUzOTBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM4OTI2MTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple's relationship is tested when uninvited guests arrive at their home, disrupting their tranquil existence."},"datePublished":"2017-10-19","description":"A couple's relationship is tested when uninvited guests arrive at their home, disrupting their tranquil existence.","keywords":"surrealism,uninvited guest,cannibalism,riot,pregnant woman","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5109784/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Alondro"},"dateCreated":"2017-09-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Art is not shoving everything into a blender...","reviewBody":"As I say in the title of my review, it is neither artful nor profound to jam every possible reference and metaphor into your movie. It's lazy. It means you have no clear direction and/or are trying to appear meaningful while being unable to resist inserting your own 'struggle' into the 'high concept'... as though you are equating yourself with the existential conflicts of gods and nature... I should think this is the penultimate epitome of pretentiousness and narcissism.

Yes, I got ALL the possible meanings of everything thrust into this amalgamation of horror and pseudo-philosophy tropes. And that was the problem... they were ALL THERE. There was no one idea prevailing; it was, as other reviewers noted, throwing all the poo against the wall and seeing what stuck... and the result was merely akin to a port-a-potty explosion.

The only reason I've given it a 2 was that there were so many abysmal movies this year that this one does rise a little higher by comparison... but only barely.

This is a movie for all the art-house crowd who believe their own self-delusions of brilliance and the Hollywood elite who pat themselves on the back ceaselessly.

I would compare it to the absurdly high praise for "Boyhood".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":199006,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Good Liar
L'art du mensonge
programme.desc: Directed by Bill Condon. With Helen Mirren, Ian McKellen, Russell Tovey, Jim Carter. Consummate con man Roy Courtnay has set his sights on his latest mark: the recently widowed Betty McLeish, worth millions. But this time, what should have been a simple swindle escalates into a cat-and-mouse game with the ultimate stakes.

programme.title: Rumor Has It..
La rumeur court
programme.desc: Rumor Has It...: Directed by Rob Reiner. With Jennifer Aniston, Kevin Costner, Shirley MacLaine, Mark Ruffalo. Sarah Huttinger is a woman who learns that her family was the inspiration for the book and film "The Graduate" -- and that she just might be the offspring of the well-documented event." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0398375/","name":"Rumor Has It...","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTg3Njk2NTIxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTc4MTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sarah Huttinger is a woman who learns that her family was the inspiration for the book and film "The Graduate" -- and that she just might be the offspring of the well-documented event.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0398375/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"howeandhill"},"dateCreated":"2005-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Don't believe the rumors you hear","reviewBody":"I like to have an idea of what the public thinks about a movie before i go and see it. This movie in particular definitely wasn't bad like people were saying. I really enjoyed it and I don't know If i can agree with what people have been saying about the movie. Its not every day I go out and see a movie like this, so it was something different for me. I do recommend the movie to people to see. After the countless love stories and such, I was starting to lose hope that there was a movie out there that could keep my interest. I was surprised by this movie and enjoyed it all the way through. It was a story that really hasn't been driven into the ground like so many recent movies. I like the twists and turns in the movie and I have always enjoyed Kevin Costner and Jennifer Aniston. It was a different sort of combination that really hit the spot.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55688,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2006-03-08","keywords":"biological father,author,search for father,female nudity,motor vehicle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Rumor Has It...","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi26280217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2ZDhiNTktMDkxYS00OWM5LTgyMTgtZDUyZDU5OGI0NGJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU2ZDhiNTktMDkxYS00OWM5LTgyMTgtZDUyZDU5OGI0NGJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer #1 for Rumor Has It..."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000098/","name":"Jennifer Aniston"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0749263/","name":"Mark Ruffalo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000511/","name":"Shirley MacLaine"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001661/","name":"Rob Reiner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013349/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0341372/","name":"Ted Griffin"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Un monde plus grand
Un monde plus grand
programme.desc:
Un monde plus grand: Directed by Fabienne Berthaud. With Cécile de France, Narantsetseg Dash, Tserendarizav Dashnyam, Ludivine Sagnier. From "Mon initiation chez les Chamanes" by Corine Sombrun. In order to forget the death of Paul, the man of her life, Corine leaves Paris for a few weeks, to direct a report in Mongolia. Her meeting with the shaman Oyun will change her life: Korine has a rare gift that Oyun intends to unveil. Korine will agree to start a journey of discovery, which will lead her to discover a new culture, ancestral and forgotten ways, but most importantly herself." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7265272/","name":"Un monde plus grand","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTM2YjE1MjAtM2Y1OC00MWUyLTkxMjktMDU4NTA0NWMyNDhmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"From "Mon initiation chez les Chamanes" by Corine Sombrun. In order to forget the death of Paul, the man of her life, Corine leaves Paris for a few weeks, to direct a report in Mongolia. Her meeting with the shaman Oyun will change h","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7265272/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Spirits in the dark.","reviewBody":"Based on true facts ,this movie is definitely off the beaten track.Its's about Shamanism a shaman is believed to interact with a spirit world through altered states of consciousness, such as trance,for healing ; some kind of equivalent of our seances in the dark ,but,should we believe the final lines, it 's taken more seriously than spiritualism.

Corine cannot come to terms with the loss of her husband ; her colleague sends her to Mongolia to film and record new sounds ; there they discover she's a female shaman ,with magic powers which might make her contact spirits of the dead .

The Mongolian landscapes are a splendor ,Cecile de France is efficient ,but directing is rather flat and sometimes one stifles a yawning ;my feelings are mixed : the great scene which fulfills the "we'll meet again " promise reminds one of too many hollywoodian movies clichés .

The adventures of this "bourgeois bohème" woman (who can afford the price of such a trip after losing a dear one?or be sent on a mission by his/her boss?) will only convince people open to persuasion ,but the others will be sceptikal about it ,at least as much as about the seances in the dark.

Forget the scientists ,the shrink who wants to fill the "depressed" woman with pills , the ridiculous sister ,and you can appreciate the documentary side of the movie .Filmed on location , one can praise the depiction of these faraway places where there's no electricity ,no running water ("no shower" says the interpret) and where religious belief is intense ;it's really a wider world ,and any viewer can be in awe of it ,even though he cannot get into the spiritual one.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":431,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-10-30","keywords":"female shaman,title directed by female,f rated,triple f rated,female protagonist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce programme.title: Dialogue avec mon jardinier
Dialogue avec mon jardinier
programme.desc: Dialogue avec mon jardinier: Directed by Jean Becker. With Daniel Auteuil, Jean-Pierre Darroussin, Fanny Cottençon, Alexia Barlier. A successful artist, weary of Parisian life and on the verge of divorce, returns to the country to live in his childhood house. He needs someone to make a real vegetable garden again out of the wilderness it has become. The gardener happens to be a former schoolfriend. A warm, fruitful conversation starts between the two men..." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0825244/","name":"Dialogue avec mon jardinier","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNjYmEwZjItY2FkZS00Y2ZhLTliNjMtZmNlYjY5ZjJjMWJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjQzMzQzODY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A successful artist, weary of Parisian life and on the verge of divorce, returns to the country to live in his childhood house. He needs someone to make a real vegetable garden again out of the wilderness it has become. The gardener ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0825244/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"josean_xx"},"dateCreated":"2008-07-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sentimental comedy, mainstream with a twist","reviewBody":"Jean Becker makes extremely typical french films, with lots of dialog, and masterful mise en scene. This film plays again with one of his favorite subjects, the wisdom of the uncultivated, working class simpletons, as opposed to the stiff way of life of the cultivated bourgeoisie. More or less. The story, a painter who goes back to the village of his childhood and befriends a retired railroad worker he hires as gardener ad happens to be an old childhood friend, serves well as an excuse for a series of enlightening dialogs and thoughts over class, life, struggle, love, etc. When it ends you have been entertained brilliantly for 90 minutes, and you are also left with something to think about."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3361,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2007-06-06","keywords":"gardener,divorce,vegetable,love,southern france","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0201669/","name":"Jean-Pierre Darroussin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0182946/","name":"Fanny Cottençon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065449/","name":"Jean Becker"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030118/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0077414/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065449/","name":"Jean Becker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0181924/","name":"Jean Cosmos"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2244089/","name":"Henri Cueco"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

The story, a painter who goes back to the village of his childhood and befriends a retired railroad worker he hires as gardener ad happens to be an old childhood friend, serves well as an excuse for a series of enlightening dialogs and thoughts over class, life, struggle, love, etc. When it ends you have been entertained brilliantly for 90 minutes, and you are also left with something to think about.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3361,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2007-06-06","keywords":"gardener,divorce,vegetable,love,southern france","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0201669/","name":"Jean-Pierre Darroussin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0182946/","name":"Fanny Cottençon"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065449/","name":"Jean Becker"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030118/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0077414/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0065449/","name":"Jean Becker","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0181924/","name":"Jean Cosmos","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2244089/","name":"Henri Cueco"],"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent="

story","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5503686/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Stay_away_from_the_Metropol"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A pill that's easy to swallow but difficult to enjoy","reviewBody":"My primary thought is that I'm happy someone made a film that shines a spotlight on a very serious problem currently becoming more common amongst sex workers. As a sex worker myself, I am exposed to the perspectives and activities of a wide array of sex workers on a daily basis. I have observed an increasing amount of sex workers who feel validated in their decisions to become con-artists, bragging proudly about robbing their own clients. While I'm happy that this is starting to be discussed in the mainstream media, that doesn't mean it's a pleasant thing to observe. It's tragic that in an era when sex work does seem to be getting to a place where it's more openly accepted, we have unabashed behavior like this which is going to make people second guess any progress we may have established thus far - it's heavily counterproductive. Overall, the movie mostly just made me feel frustrated, sad, and worried for the future - but it was the correlation to reality that I couldn't get off of my mind. I wasn't very enveloped in the world of the film itself - mostly just reminded of my worries regarding the industry and the way it's pupils and society will carry on being effected by on another from here on out.

As a film alone, it was okay. The performances were sufficient but nothing that stood out, which is more a result of the writing. Uninteresting characters caught up in uninteresting events. Overall, the plot FEELS like it should be entertaining, but the movie is a bit redundant - once you get into the thick of it, you're basically watching a repetitive cycle with not much movement to it. And as it goes on, you kind of like the characters less and less, with no real conflicting energies - so it kind of just gets worse as it goes. The movie could have use some cutting - there's not enough depth or complexity to it to validate a nearly 2 hour run time, unfortunately.

The movie did have a handful of very amusing moments, but it was not enough to redeem the thing as a whole. It's not a bad movie, but it's also not a good movie...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":88029,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ce qui nous lie
Ce qui nous lie
programme.desc: Ce qui nous lie: Directed by Cédric Klapisch. With Pio Marmaï, Ana Girardot, François Civil, Jean-Marc Roulot. After a 10 year absence, Jean returns to his hometown when his father falls ill. Reuniting with his sister Juliette and his brother Jérémie, they have to re-build their relationship and trust as a family again." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5247704/","name":"Ce qui nous lie","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmI2MjgyYzUtZTEzMy00M2IwLWJjMGQtNDgyODBjNWVkODNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDU0NjMyNTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a 10 year absence, Jean returns to his hometown when his father falls ill. Reuniting with his sister Juliette and his brother Jérémie, they have to re-build their relationship and trust as a family again.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5247704/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kaptenvideo-89875"},"dateCreated":"2017-08-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's not a standout work but quietly confident and satisfying","reviewBody":"Making wine and drama. Jean (Pio Marmaï) left his family home ten years ago. When father falls ill, he returns and reunites with his sister Juliette (Ana Girardot) and brother Jérémie (François Civil), to sort out stuff between them. Ah families. Their problems and conflicts seem very important for themselves, but are often difficult to understand for bystanders. This is also true for writer-director Cédric Klapisch's latest, slow-burning but quite nice drama about the importance of family and the power of forgiving. The short summary feels sugary, and Klapisch does aim for feel-good, but the movie does not try to manipulate with audience in any tasteless way. It is actually realistic depiction of well-behaved and intelligent family's life, where everybody has their problems but these are not solved in overtly dramatic way often expected from family sagas. This subtle approach doesn't make for very engaging drama, but the feel-good factor is important part of the movie. If you care to invest yourself in these characters' lives, you will probably feel like a part of their group in their end. Which is the best thing this kind of movie can ask for. One can also learn quite a lot about making and appreciating wine. 113 minutes makes it rather long watch, it's not a standout work but quietly confident and satisfying. I don't like international and also Estonian title Back to Burgundy" (Tagasi Burgundiasse") which is not as eloquent as the original – directly translated What Links Us" (Mis meid seob"). But you would have to watch the movie to care about this, I guess.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4376,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2017-06-14","keywords":"father son relationship,strong women,vineyard,brother sister relationship,brother brother relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Back to Burgundy","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2620635161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjY3NjRjODAtOTU5NS00OWE0LWIzOGQtMDAxODgwMGUzM2Q2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjY3NjRjODAtOTU5NS00OWE0LWIzOGQtMDAxODgwMGUzM2Q2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2847812/","name":"Pio Marmaï"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320759/","name":"Ana Girardot"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2476624/","name":"François Civil"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0458251/","name":"Cédric Klapisch"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0458251/","name":"Cédric Klapisch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0024887/","name":"Santiago Amigorena"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0745694/","name":"Jean-Marc Roulot"}],"duration":"PT1H53M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Pride & Prejudice
Orgueil et préjugés
programme.desc:
Pride & Prejudice: Directed by Joe Wright. With Keira Knightley, Talulah Riley, Rosamund Pike, Jena Malone. Sparks fly when spirited Elizabeth Bennet meets single, rich, and proud Mr. Darcy. But Mr. Darcy reluctantly finds himself falling in love with a woman beneath his class. Can each overcome their own pride and prejudice?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0414387/","name":"Pride & Prejudice","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1NDQ3NTcyOTNeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDA0MzA4MzE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0461136/","name":"Keira Knightley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532193/","name":"Matthew Macfadyen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000950/","name":"Brenda Blethyn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0942504/","name":"Joe Wright"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042399/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0595738/","name":"Deborah Moggach"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000807/","name":"Jane Austen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Pride & Prejudice","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3045130521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjAwOTY1MDktM2IxMy00MTA4LWI4NjEtNWM1ZjNmMWJmMzkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjAwOTY1MDktM2IxMy00MTA4LWI4NjEtNWM1ZjNmMWJmMzkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Focus Features"},"datePublished":"2006-05-10","description":"Sparks fly when spirited Elizabeth Bennet meets single, rich, and proud Mr. Darcy. But Mr. Darcy reluctantly finds himself falling in love with a woman beneath his class. Can each overcome their own pride and prejudice?","keywords":"pride and prejudice,england,gentleman,bachelor,pride","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0414387/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mankindk"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Acting is superb","reviewBody":"While I will say first off, that no movie production ever made will ever equal a novel, especially one of this magnitude, this movie is very well done. I read many reviews going either way, but I must say I enjoyed the film very much. Many are quick to criticize Mac's performance saying he didn't do a good job. I thought he was fine, but believe me he is no Colin. Keira Knightley was absolutely incredible in the film, I would go as far to say it is her breakout performance. Donald Sutherland was amazing, but as can be expected from him. Judi, like always is incredible at her role as Lady Catherine.

If you are a complete avid fan of the book as I am, you may or may not like it. My only complaint was that it was in fact short, but then again it is quite hard to make a 370+ page novel into a two hour movie easily. There is a phenomenal display of acting by the entire cast, and the score is perfect.

One warning though, the movie concentrates on the love story more than Austen's satire of society, so many Austen fans may be angry with that. But overall I thought it was a great film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":267701,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

But Mr. Darcy reluctantly finds himself falling in love with a woman beneath his class. Can each overcome their own pride and prejudice?","keywords":"pride and prejudice,england,gentleman,bachelor,pride","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0414387/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mankindk","dateCreated":"2005-11-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Acting is superb","reviewBody":"While I will say first off, that no movie production ever made will ever equal a novel, especially one of this magnitude, this movie is very well done. I read many reviews going either way, but I must say I enjoyed the film very much. Many are quick to criticize Mac's performance saying he didn't do a good job. I thought he was fine, but believe me he is no Colin. Keira Knightley was absolutely incredible in the film, I would go as far to say it is her breakout performance. Donald Sutherland was amazing, but as can be expected from him. Judi, like always is incredible at her role as Lady Catherine.

If you are a complete avid fan of the book as I am, you may or may not like it. My only complaint was that it was in fact short, but then again it is quite hard to make a 370+ page novel into a two hour movie easily. There is a phenomenal display of acting by the entire cast, and the score is perfect.

One warning though, the movie concentrates on the love story more than Austen's satire of society, so many Austen fans may be angry with that. But overall I thought it was a great film.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":267701,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"duration":"PT2H9M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 3 zéros
3 zéros
programme.desc:
3 zéros: Directed by Fabien Onteniente. With Gérard Lanvin, Samuel Le Bihan, Lorànt Deutsch, Gérard Darmon. At the Fresnes remand center, a football match takes place in the courtyard. Tibor Kovacs, a young Hungarian, works wonders with the ball. A true football virtuoso, he dreams of playing for the French team." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0295736/","name":"3 zéros","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3MDU0MzE3NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzM3MjcyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"At the Fresnes remand center, a football match takes place in the courtyard. A true football virtuoso, he dreams of playing for the French team.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0295736/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mtuvignon"},"dateCreated":"2006-03-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny","reviewBody":"This movie is just plain funny. It is not a satire in any way, although it depicts the world of soccer player agents, but not in a Jerry McGuire kind of way.

The first purpose of this movie is to gather a bunch of French comedians, while taking soccer as a setting.

The result is a funny movie, not because of the plot which is not the greatest, but because it includes extremely funny lines, which our British friend might not have understood since most of them are French cultural jokes.

Anyways, this is a delightful moment, and it would be a shame if you didn't see this movie at least once.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1132,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.3},"genre":["Comedy","Sport"],"datePublished":"2002-04-24","keywords":"soccer,male rear nudity,male nudity,male frontal nudity,satire","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0487254/","name":"Gérard Lanvin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0494078/","name":"Samuel Le Bihan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0222088/","name":"Lorànt Deutsch"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0648902/","name":"Fabien Onteniente"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024879/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0032439/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0095878/","name":"Emanuel Booz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1155314/","name":"Philippe Guillard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0648902/","name":"Fabien Onteniente"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Prince and the Pauper
Le prince et le pauvre
programme.desc: The Prince and the Pauper: Directed by Richard Fleischer. With Oliver Reed, Raquel Welch, Mark Lester, Ernest Borgnine. Poor boy Tom Canty and Edward, Prince of Wales exchange identities, but events force the pair to experience each other's lives as well." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0077381/","name":"The Prince and the Pauper","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAyZjM2OTMtN2Q2Ny00OWRmLTkyNDctM2QxZGRmNmY0OGM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Poor boy Tom Canty and Edward, Prince of Wales exchange identities, but events force the pair to experience each other's lives as well.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0077381/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mccarter"},"dateCreated":"1999-10-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Star-studded version of Twain's Prince and the Pauper","reviewBody":"I haven't seen this movie in 20 years, but I remember going to it mostly because of the impressive cast. The lead, playing the dual roles of the prince and the pauper, was Mark Lester, lately of "Oliver". It was too "lately". By the time this movie came out, Lester was FAR too old for the part(s) of street urchin and child king. Charlton Heston (he's Henry VIII here) seems attracted to this phenomenon. He also did Treasure Island with a too old Christian Bale as Jim Hawkins. Anyway, Heston and the rest of the cast did fine jobs, and the picture is good fun if you can fully suspend disbelief in deep voiced Lester as an innocent child."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1762,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1978-03-17","keywords":"slapstick comedy,period drama,boy,prince,king","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Prince and the Pauper aka "Crossed Swords"","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2633105689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzc1M2Q2MzEtZDIxNS00MTZjLWFiMmEtODYwZTMxY2U5NjVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzc1M2Q2MzEtZDIxNS00MTZjLWFiMmEtODYwZTMxY2U5NjVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Warner Bros. IMDb data; ttnr: 5976196, Title: Königin von Niendorf, --- Description: Königin von Niendorf: Directed by Joya Thome. With Lisa Moell, Denny Sonnenschein, Salim Fazzani, Ivo T. Michligk. A declaration of love to childhood about a girl's struggle for her place in the boys world. Summer holidays have just begun in the small Brandenburg town of Niendorf but ten-year-old Lea is not going to the summer camp with her friends this year as usual. Lea wants to be part of the boy gang in her village, so she faces a dare. programme.title: Tante Hilda
Tante Hilda!
programme.desc: Tante Hilda!: Directed by Benoît Chieux, Jacques-Rémy Girerd. With Sabine Azéma, Josiane Balasko, François Morel, Bruno Lochet. Centers on an eccentric aunt who is everything to everyone." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1671584/","name":"Tante Hilda!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjdlNGYzOTktMWRiOS00NTJiLWIzNDgtNzJmYmVhOThlOGU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU3ODUxMTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Centers on an eccentric aunt who is everything to everyone.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1671584/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"franbelle10"},"dateCreated":"2016-08-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice ecology-comedy for the whole family","reviewBody":"This is a nice animation for the whole family (age 8+), on an ecology-comedy style. There are some similarities with "Mia and the Migou" (from the same Jacques-Remy Gired), but a lighter treatment of the ecological theme ; the balance is tipping a bit more on the comedy and poetry side which makes it more suitable for younger children. The theme doesn't deal with deforestation this time but genetically modified organisms and chemistry in agronomy. Still the message remains understandable by younger ones even if they can't understand the engineering at work. Animation process is lighter and brighter as well, colorfully sketched on white background. Scenario is inventive with many rebounds while the whole story remains linear and easy to understand for children. That doesn't means adults are forgotten; characters are caricatured but there is a second level for adults completely transparent and compatible with them (no sexual jokes nor anything like that ; the only victim would be political and capitalist greed).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":137,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"genre":["Animation","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2014-02-12","keywords":"aunt","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0044535/","name":"Sabine Azéma"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001929/","name":"Josiane Balasko"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0603586/","name":"François Morel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0157345/","name":"Benoît Chieux"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320868/","name":"Jacques-Rémy Girerd"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028384/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0296341/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0068476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0320868/","name":"Jacques-Rémy Girerd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0157345/","name":"Benoît Chieux"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0853451/","name":"Iouri Tcherenkov"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hoodwinked Too! Hood vs. Evil
La vengeance du petit chaperon rouge
programme.desc:
Hoodwinked Too! Hood vs. Evil: Directed by Mike Disa. With Hayden Panettiere, Glenn Close, Patrick Warburton, Joan Cusack. Red Riding Hood is training in the group of Sister Hoods, when she and the Wolf are called to examine the sudden mysterious disappearance of Hansel and Gretel." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0844993/","name":"Hoodwinked Too! Hood vs. Evil","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0OTk4ODA3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTU2NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Red Riding Hood is training in the group of Sister Hoods, when she and the Wolf are called to examine the sudden mysterious disappearance of Hansel and Gretel.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0844993/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TBJCSKCNRRQTreviews"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Why are we laughing?","reviewBody":"The Happily Ever After agency try to save Hansel and Gretel from the witch in the gingerbread house.

I'm going to try to be as objective as I can be in this. I love the first one, although, even if I didn't, I still would only think this one was mediocre. It's not completely without merit. To get the obvious out of the way: the animation is much much better this time around. The first one essentially reimagined the story of Red Riding Hood into a mystery story, with four distinctly different perspectives on the events leading up to and including that fairy tale's ending. This one has a more straightforward action-adventure approach. Obviously that isn't going to have the same effect, but then they also couldn't just do the same thing again. The Wolf(Warburton, who clearly realises how much lesser this is than the first entry) sees his character assassinated(...not literally), as he's made really stupid so they can use that as fodder for Laughs.

This is simply nowhere near as funny as the original. It goes the the Zucker-Abrahams route, by including as many jokes as at all possible, hoping that it will make the end product better. It does not. Somewhere between 1/3 and maybe even half of the material, simply is not particularly good. There's too much crude slapstick. The puns are painful. I like Hayden Panettiere, a lot, and when it comes to Hathaway, it's not like I'm an Anne stan or anything. However. it is hard to deny that they are not equally talented, at least not at the role of Red.

I recommend this only to those who simply need to watch everything related to these characters, and everyone else is basically better off pretending it doesn't exist. 5/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12608,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2011-04-29","keywords":"female protagonist,male antagonist,female antagonist,slimehouse,little red riding hood character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hoodwinked Too! programme.title: Robots
Robots
programme.desc:
Robots: Directed by Chris Wedge, Carlos Saldanha. With Paula Abdul, Halle Berry, Lucille Bliss, Terry Bradshaw. In a robot world, a young idealistic inventor travels to the big city to join his inspiration's company, only to find himself opposing its sinister new management." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0358082/","name":"Robots","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmJhNTQwY2MtYTU0Yy00NDVhLThiZTktNmMxZTk5Nzk3NzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTUyMzE4Mzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a robot world, a young idealistic inventor travels to the big city to join his inspiration's company, only to find himself opposing its sinister new management.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0358082/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Smells_Like_Cheese"},"dateCreated":"2007-09-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Original and visually stunning!","reviewBody":"Yesterday I was shopping at Target and they had a bunch of movies for seven fifty, Robots was one of them. I never saw the movie before, but I figured it's just a couple more bucks then if I rented it, so I bought it and watched it last night. I have to say that I'm glad I bought it because I really enjoyed it, this was a fun animated movie that got over looked in 2005. It had great actors for the voices, Mel Brooks couldn't have been a more perfect choice, the whole look of the movie is absolutely cool to look at, and the story was extremely original. This is a great film to watch for yourself or with the family.

Rodney is a common robot with his poor parents, but he has big city dreams to meet Bigweld, the biggest robot of all time, he is the inventor who makes sure that every robot is taken care of. Rodney goes to the big city to meet Bigweld and become an inventor himself, but ends up meeting several robots who are nobody's including Fender, his new best friend. They discover that an evil robot who has taken over Bigweld's factory is planning on destroying all the old bots who can't afford to upgrade, so pretty much that's the whole town. But Rodney and his friends are dedicated to making sure that everyone can be safe as an old bot.

Robots is a very imaginative movie with a very creative story and look. I was really impressed with this movie and would highly recommend it. It has very funny moments for both the kids and the adults, so it works for a family movie very well. Robin Williams did a terrific job as Vender, he was just a great addition and brought fun comedic relief. But the whole cast sounded like they had a lot of fun with this movie. This is a fun film to watch and I think anyone could enjoy it, so grab the popcorn, because you're gonna have fun.

7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":137599,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2005-04-13","keywords":"robot,parents,male protagonist,title directed by male,title directed by man","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Robots Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi698332697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE4NTA1NDU1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTk1NDgxMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE4NTA1NDU1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTk1NDgxMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Robots"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000191/","name":"Ewan McGregor"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000932/","name":"Halle Berry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000316/","name":"Mel Brooks"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0917188/","name":"Chris Wedge"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0757858/","name":"Carlos Saldanha"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179259/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047265/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593856/","name":"Ron Mita"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0572151/","name":"Jim McClain"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1865755/","name":"David Lindsay-Abaire"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Le fils à Jo
Le fils à Jo
programme.desc:
Le fils à Jo: Directed by Philippe Guillard. With Gérard Lanvin, Olivier Marchal, Vincent Moscato, Jérémie Duvall. To continue the family legacy of rugby players, Jo starts a rugby team for his son, Tom, who is bad at rugby." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1548603/","name":"Le fils à Jo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk4MTYxMDI4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDIyNzE2NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"To continue the family legacy of rugby players, Jo starts a rugby team for his son, Tom, who is bad at rugby.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1548603/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"searchanddestroy-1"},"dateCreated":"2012-01-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Jo's son","reviewBody":"I did not go to see this film when it was released, one year ago. I already knew it was not for me, not for my taste. It was aired on TV last month, and I finally decided to watch it. OK, it is a cute little movie about hope, friendship and forever good feelings. How the hell anyone could say any harm about such a film?

Full of clichés, everything is predictable but it may be relaxing for anyone who wants to forget daily stress and problems. Actors are pretty generous, as their own characters in this perhaps cheesy - but not lousy - feature for folks in love with human relationship full of faith, and also sport. Rugby, in this case.

A friends' film, made not only for money, even a child could feel it."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":569,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2011-01-12","keywords":"village,father son relationship,rural setting,rugby","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0487254/","name":"Gérard Lanvin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545356/","name":"Olivier Marchal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0608295/","name":"Vincent Moscato"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1155314/","name":"Philippe Guillard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007686/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0322490/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0172053/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1155314/","name":"Philippe Guillard"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stars by the Pound
100 kilos d'étoiles
programme.desc:
Stars by the Pound: Directed by Marie-Sophie Chambon. With Laure Duchene, Angèle Metzger, Pauline Serieys, Zoé De Tarlé. Lois, 16, has had only one dream since she was a child: becoming an astronaut." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7501966/","name":"Stars by the Pound","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTczOGI4MTQtYWRlMS00ZDJiLWI5M2EtYzQ2YmI5YmZkNWMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA4MDA0Mjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lois, 16, has had only one dream since she was a child: becoming an astronaut.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7501966/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hey Mr.Spaceman, won't you please take me along for a ride?","reviewBody":"This movie was labeled "feel good" and I'm not sure it's an accurate depiction of it ;it's not a comedy ,the young teenage girl 's dream is to become an astronaut but her dream may never come true ;she seems to live on Jupiter,where she would weigh 250 kg (=550 lb) and the story begins with a lecture on the solar system by herself : actually she wants to escape from the good old Earth where she is not a really happy person : she's extremely good at physics and maths ,but she's overweight (check the title which sums it all in a very succint style )and her teacher tells her that to fly to the stars may be only a dream .If she is obese it's congenital , her mother has the same problem :there's a moving scene in which the husband tells her love to his wife ,even though she does not fit the female canons of beauty ,without using the usual "the- real- beauty- is -inside- you" cliché ;this unfortunate mother has a strong feeling of guilt.

Obsessed by her weight, the teenager becomes anorexic and is fed through a tube ;with three other patients she flees to Toulouse ,where a competition of young scientists is to take place :her invention is a pilot balloon.A revealing fact,they are the only girls among the contenders !This depiction of female friendship is uncompromising and does not pass over in silence the conflicts ,without the presence of a single boy ,no small feat.

Of course ,there are some drawbacks (the obligatory song in English :haven't we got good French songs?) and the screenplay is sometimes disjointed .

But all is forgiven when you see this dreamlike scene where the team launches their balloon en route to the stars ,which seems to take the foursome away with it.

NB :The leading actress had already been cast in a short ,"princesse" ,when she was a child.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":122,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2019-07-17","keywords":"dream","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-Annonce [VO]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1074904089","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDFhNTQyNDUtNmJmYi00ZDhhLTg0NWUtNDlhMTkwNzE3YjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDFhNTQyNDUtNmJmYi00ZDhhLTg0NWUtNDlhMTkwNzE3YjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10743148/","name":"Laure Duchene"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7742761/","name":"Angèle Metzger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1551852/","name":"Pauline Serieys"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3930693/","name":"Marie-Sophie Chambon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0437899/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0305542/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4396038/","name":"Anaïs Carpita"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3930693/","name":"Marie-Sophie Chambon"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Penelope
Pénélope
programme.desc:
Penelope: Directed by Mark Palansky. With Richard E. Grant, Catherine O'Hara, Nick Prideaux, Michael Feast. A modern romantic tale about a young aristocratic heiress born under a curse that can only be broken when she finds true love with "one who will accept her as one of their own."" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0472160/","name":"Penelope","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM1M2Y3NWUtOWM1MS00YjUzLThiNmEtNjdiMTZmMzg3NTY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern romantic tale about a young aristocratic heiress born under a curse that can only be broken when she finds true love with "one who will accept her as one of their own."","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0472160/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rrigby19"},"dateCreated":"2007-06-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Beautiful Film!","reviewBody":"I saw "Penelope" at the US premiere at CineVegas last week. It has a very sweet message about self-acceptance that we could all use a little more of these days. I loved the hyper- real, brightly colored, Tim Burtonesque look of the film, it helped to accentuate the fairy tale aspect. 

I also thought all of the performances, especially Christina Ricci and Katherine O'Hara, were excellent. Reese Witherspoon as a leather wearing, gum chewing, scooter riding messenger girl seemed a bit miscast, but she was actually good and had one of the funnier lines of the film.

While there's nothing laugh out loud funny, this sweet story makes you smile again and again.

IMDb data; ttnr: 0472160, Title: Penelope, --- Description: Penelope: Directed by Mark Palansky. With Richard E. Grant, Catherine O'Hara, Nick Prideaux, Michael Feast. A modern romantic tale about a young aristocratic heiress born under a curse that can only be broken when she finds true love with "one who will accept her as one of their own."" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0472160/","name":"Penelope","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM1M2Y3NWUtOWM1MS00YjUzLThiNmEtNjdiMTZmMzg3NTY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A modern romantic tale about a young aristocratic heiress born under a curse that can only be broken when she finds true love with "one who will accept her as one of their own."","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0472160/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"rrigby19","dateCreated":"2007-06-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Beautiful Film!","reviewBody":"I saw "Penelope" at the US premiere at CineVegas last week. It has a very sweet message about self-acceptance that we could all use a little more of these days. I loved the hyper- real, brightly colored, Tim Burtonesque look of the film, it helped to accentuate the fairy tale aspect. 

I also thought all of the performances, especially Christina Ricci and Katherine O'Hara, were excellent. Reese Witherspoon as a leather wearing, gum chewing, scooter riding messenger girl seemed a bit miscast, but she was actually good and had one of the funnier lines of the film.

While there's nothing laugh out loud funny, this sweet story makes you smile again and again. 

I would recommend this film for audiences of all ages because I don't think you're ever too old for it's message and it doesn't talk down to an adult audience.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":61314,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2008-02-01","keywords":"magical realism,rich parents,female protagonist,scarf,mother daughter relationship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Penelope","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi749863193","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEyNTYxMDEyNTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDMxOTU2MzMx._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEyNTYxMDEyNTJeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDMxOTU2MzMx._V1_.jpg","description":"Penelope Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000207/","name":"Christina Ricci","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564215/","name":"James McAvoy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000702/","name":"Reese Witherspoon"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0657372/","name":"Mark Palansky"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003987/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0081041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0147092/","name":"Leslie Caveny"],"duration":"PT1H44M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Win a Date with Tad Hamilton
Rendez-vous avec une star
programme.desc: Win a Date with Tad Hamilton!: Directed by Robert Luketic. With Kate Bosworth, Topher Grace, Josh Duhamel, Nathan Lane. A small-town girl wins a date with a male celebrity through a contest. When the date goes better than expected, a love triangle forms between the girl, the male celebrity, and the girl's best friend." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0335559/","name":"Win a Date with Tad Hamilton!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM0ODcyNjA4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjM3NjQyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A small-town girl wins a date with a male celebrity through a contest. When the date goes better than expected, a love triangle forms between the girl, the male celebrity, and the girl's best friend.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0335559/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ashleigh129"},"dateCreated":"2004-02-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Kate Bosworth was not right for the role...","reviewBody":"I felt like this movie could have been a lot better if there had been some real chemistry between both Tad (Josh Duhamel) and Rosalee (Kate Bosworth) and Pete (Topher Grace) and Rosalee would have had just a little bit of chemistry. Rosalee was so ditzy and had no personality or substance in the film, although both of the men chasing after her claimed that she did. I didn't root for either couple to stay with her, because I couldn't believe that either character would have been interested in her. Her first scenes when she met Tad were extremely cheesy, and her annoying accent when conversing with Pete was too much to handle. Too bad since Topher Grace is fabulous in any role and the hotness of Josh Duhamel cancels out any flaws in his acting.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":27286,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-12-08","keywords":"fictional celebrity,montage of los angeles driving shots,date,best friend,west virginia","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Win a Date with Tad Hamiliton","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2156181017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQyMjk5ODQ2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTAxNDMyMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQyMjk5ODQ2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTAxNDMyMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Win a Date with Tad Hamilton"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0098378/","name":"Kate Bosworth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0241049/","name":"Josh Duhamel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0333410/","name":"Topher Grace"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0525659/","name":"Robert Luketic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093794/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093253/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505741/","name":"Victor Levin"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Beauty Shop
Beauty Shop
programme.desc: Beauty Shop: Directed by Bille Woodruff. With Queen Latifah, Alicia Silverstone, Andie MacDowell, Alfre Woodard. A determined hairstylist (Queen Latifah) competes with her former boss (Kevin Bacon) after opening her own business in Atlanta." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0388500/","name":"Beauty Shop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA2OTM0MTA2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjE4MjgyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A determined hairstylist (Queen Latifah) competes with her former boss (Kevin Bacon) after opening her own business in Atlanta.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0388500/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dmturner"},"dateCreated":"2005-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Harmless fun","reviewBody":"This amusing little movie appeals to a wide range with its comfortable humor, racy but utterly inoffensive conversation, and its roots in Disney-style family values (but for the real world). Queen Latifah does a relaxed and amiable job of tying the film together, and the ensemble cast is sweet and funny. I was impressed with Alicia Silverstone's turn as a geeky little white country girl--it's the first time she hasn't been playing off a well-to-do type and she carries it off. We had a nice relaxing time of it while we were watching, and half an hour later I've forgotten most of it--but that's just fine. Means I can pop it in the DVD player later on, enjoy it, and not remember a word.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16730,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2005-03-30","keywords":"f rated,couch,fat woman,thrown out,long haired man","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3364012313","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTlhNDg2MTYtN2FhMy00YTc0LThiYWMtYzk3ZTE2NzJjY2RmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTlhNDg2MTYtN2FhMy00YTc0LThiYWMtYzk3ZTE2NzJjY2RmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001451/","name":"Queen Latifah"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000224/","name":"Alicia Silverstone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005023/","name":"Djimon Hounsou"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937306/","name":"Bille Woodruff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007143/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0068765/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064942/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0402804/","name":"Elizabeth Hunter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0486824/","name":"Kate Lanier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0888491/","name":"Norman Vance Jr."}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda
Kung Fu Panda
programme.desc:
Kung Fu Panda: Directed by Mark Osborne, John Stevenson. With Jack Black, Dustin Hoffman, Angelina Jolie, Ian McShane. The Dragon Warrior has to clash against the savage Tai Lung as China's fate hangs in the balance. However, the Dragon Warrior mantle is supposedly mistaken to be bestowed upon an obese panda who is a novice in martial arts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0441773/","name":"Kung Fu Panda","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODJkZTZhMWItMDI3Yy00ZWZlLTk4NjQtOTI1ZjU5NjBjZTVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Action","Adventure"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085312/","name":"Jack Black"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0574534/","name":"Ian McShane"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001401/","name":"Angelina Jolie"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0651706/","name":"Mark Osborne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0828970/","name":"John Stevenson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0740156/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0008743/","name":"Jonathan Aibel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0074184/","name":"Glenn Berger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0717550/","name":"Ethan Reiff"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Kung Fu Panda","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi330432793","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMjcyNTcxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzI4NDQ4._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMjcyNTcxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzI4NDQ4._V1_.jpg","description":"Kung Fu Panda Trailer"},"datePublished":"2008-06-11","description":"The Dragon Warrior has to clash against the savage Tai Lung as China's fate hangs in the balance. However, the Dragon Warrior mantle is supposedly mistaken to be bestowed upon an obese panda who is a novice in martial arts.","keywords":"anthropomorphic animal,kung fu,china,martial arts,giant panda","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0441773/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"yellocar"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Jack Black is the Greatest Panda in the World!","reviewBody":"Caught a screening of "The Panda" and all I can say is wow! I took my 6 year old daughter, who has the attention span of a 6 year old, and she wants to see it again. So do I! 

Jack Black is not only half of the greatest band in the world, he is also a fine voice actor. His flawed character, Po the Panda is very refreshing. So is this film. After having to sit through the boring "Over the Hedge" and the last two "Shrek" messes, I really appreciated an animated feature form Dreamworks that didn't have too many celeb voices all competing for screen time. This is Jack Black's movie. He has 75% of the lines in the script and that is not a bad thing. 

Don't just drop the kids off to see Kung Fu Panda. Go with them. I think it's one of those rare movies like The Incredibles and Finding Nemo that adults can enjoy as much as the kids.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":432263,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

However, the Dragon Warrior mantle is supposedly mistaken to be bestowed upon an obese panda who is a novice in martial arts.","keywords":"anthropomorphic animal,kung fu,china,martial arts,giant panda","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0441773/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"yellocar","dateCreated":"2008-06-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Jack Black is the Greatest Panda in the World!","reviewBody":"Caught a screening of "The Panda" and all I can say is wow! I took my 6 year old daughter, who has the attention span of a 6 year old, and she wants to see it again. So do I! 

Jack Black is not only half of the greatest band in the world, he is also a fine voice actor. His flawed character, Po the Panda is very refreshing. So is this film. After having to sit through the boring "Over the Hedge" and the last two "Shrek" messes, I really appreciated an animated feature form Dreamworks that didn't have too many celeb voices all competing for screen time. This is Jack Black's movie. He has 75% of the lines in the script and that is not a bad thing. 

Don't just drop the kids off to see Kung Fu Panda. Go with them. I think it's one of those rare movies like The Incredibles and Finding Nemo that adults can enjoy as much as the kids.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":432263,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"duration":"PT1H32M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Himalaya
programme.desc: Dans un village situé sur les contreforts de l'Himalaya, le vieux chef Tinlé est persuadé que Karma, dans l'espoir de diriger la communauté, a provoqué la mort de son héritier durant la dernière expédition sur les hauts plateaux. Tinlé décide alors que Passang, son petit-fils, prendra la place du disparu à la tête de la prochaine caravane. Mais Passang est jeune et le conseil des Anciens lui préfère Karma.

credits.actor: Gurgon Kyap

programme.title: The Prince and the Pauper
Le prince et le pauvre
programme.desc: The Prince and the Pauper: Directed by Richard Fleischer. With Oliver Reed, Raquel Welch, Mark Lester, Ernest Borgnine. Poor boy Tom Canty and Edward, Prince of Wales exchange identities, but events force the pair to experience each other's lives as well." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0077381/","name":"The Prince and the Pauper","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAyZjM2OTMtN2Q2Ny00OWRmLTkyNDctM2QxZGRmNmY0OGM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Poor boy Tom Canty and Edward, Prince of Wales exchange identities, but events force the pair to experience each other's lives as well.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0077381/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mccarter"},"dateCreated":"1999-10-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Star-studded version of Twain's Prince and the Pauper","reviewBody":"I haven't seen this movie in 20 years, but I remember going to it mostly because of the impressive cast. The lead, playing the dual roles of the prince and the pauper, was Mark Lester, lately of "Oliver". It was too "lately". By the time this movie came out, Lester was FAR too old for the part(s) of street urchin and child king. Charlton Heston (he's Henry VIII here) seems attracted to this phenomenon. He also did Treasure Island with a too old Christian Bale as Jim Hawkins. Anyway, Heston and the rest of the cast did fine jobs, and the picture is good fun if you can fully suspend disbelief in deep voiced Lester as an innocent child."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1762,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1978-03-17","keywords":"slapstick comedy,period drama,boy,prince,king","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Prince and the Pauper aka "Crossed Swords"","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2633105689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzc1M2Q2MzEtZDIxNS00MTZjLWFiMmEtODYwZTMxY2U5NjVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzc1M2Q2MzEtZDIxNS00MTZjLWFiMmEtODYwZTMxY2U5NjVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Warner Bros. programme.title: Hercule & Sherlock
Hercule et Sherlock
programme.desc: Hercule & Sherlock: Directed by Jeannot Szwarc. With Christopher Lambert, Richard Anconina, Philippine Leroy-Beaulieu, Roland Blanche. With a shipment of counterfeit banknotes waylaid, and their boss in jail, two small-time hoods, Bruno and Vincent, find themselves forced to dognap two canines who have been trained... to sniff out counterfeit money!" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116520/","name":"Hercule & Sherlock","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEwNjQ0NDg4Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjcxMzgwMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"With a shipment of counterfeit banknotes waylaid, and their boss in jail, two small-time hoods, Bruno and Vincent, find themselves forced to dognap two canines who have been trained... to sniff out counterfeit money!","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116520/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kelly-64"},"dateCreated":"1999-06-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Truly an awesome view of Chris!","reviewBody":"I didn't understand much of the dialog itself.. but, body language, facial expressions, situations themselves told the whole story. I loved it. Chris smoking and Richard throwing it out the window.. Chris throwing the radio out the window in retaliation! It was the funniest, warmest, most human film I have seen him in in a long time. Way to go, Chris.. programme.title: Kung Fu Panda
Kung Fu Panda
programme.desc:
Kung Fu Panda: Directed by Mark Osborne, John Stevenson. With Jack Black, Dustin Hoffman, Angelina Jolie, Ian McShane. The Dragon Warrior has to clash against the savage Tai Lung as China's fate hangs in the balance. However, the Dragon Warrior mantle is supposedly mistaken to be bestowed upon an obese panda who is a novice in martial arts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0441773/","name":"Kung Fu Panda","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODJkZTZhMWItMDI3Yy00ZWZlLTk4NjQtOTI1ZjU5NjBjZTVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Action","Adventure"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085312/","name":"Jack Black"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0574534/","name":"Ian McShane"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001401/","name":"Angelina Jolie"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0651706/","name":"Mark Osborne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0828970/","name":"John Stevenson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0740156/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0008743/","name":"Jonathan Aibel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0074184/","name":"Glenn Berger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0717550/","name":"Ethan Reiff"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Kung Fu Panda","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi330432793","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMjcyNTcxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzI4NDQ4._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMjcyNTcxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzI4NDQ4._V1_.jpg","description":"Kung Fu Panda Trailer"},"datePublished":"2008-06-11","description":"The Dragon Warrior has to clash against the savage Tai Lung as China's fate hangs in the balance. However, the Dragon Warrior mantle is supposedly mistaken to be bestowed upon an obese panda who is a novice in martial arts.","keywords":"anthropomorphic animal,kung fu,china,martial arts,giant panda","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0441773/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"yellocar"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Jack Black is the Greatest Panda in the World!","reviewBody":"Caught a screening of "The Panda" and all I can say is wow! I took my 6 year old daughter, who has the attention span of a 6 year old, and she wants to see it again. So do I! 

Jack Black is not only half of the greatest band in the world, he is also a fine voice actor. His flawed character, Po the Panda is very refreshing. So is this film. After having to sit through the boring "Over the Hedge" and the last two "Shrek" messes, I really appreciated an animated feature form Dreamworks that didn't have too many celeb voices all competing for screen time. This is Jack Black's movie. He has 75% of the lines in the script and that is not a bad thing. 

Don't just drop the kids off to see Kung Fu Panda. Go with them. I think it's one of those rare movies like The Incredibles and Finding Nemo that adults can enjoy as much as the kids.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":432263,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dick Tracy
Dick Tracy
programme.desc: Dick Tracy: Directed by Warren Beatty. With Warren Beatty, Charlie Korsmo, Michael Donovan O'Donnell, Jim Wilkey. The comic strip detective finds his life vastly complicated when Breathless Mahoney makes advances towards him while he is trying to battle Big Boy Caprice's united mob." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0099422/","name":"Dick Tracy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzA5MDg5ZDAtOWE1YS00Nzg2LTk5NzUtMDY3ZDZlN2U2M2ZlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwNzk3NDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The comic strip detective finds his life vastly complicated when Breathless Mahoney makes advances towards him while he is trying to battle Big Boy Caprice's united mob.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0099422/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tfrizzell"},"dateCreated":"2002-07-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"It Does Make an Impression.","reviewBody":"An all-star cast, vivid colors that could give you a headache and Madonna's sizzling performance made many think that "Dick Tracy" is much better than it actually is. It is one of those typical quantity over quality projects that uses smoke and mirrors to make the audience think that it is something unique and intriguing. However, the film is little more than a comic strip that jumps up at you ala the "Superman" or "Batman" group of films. Warren Beatty's performance and in-your-face direction are not totally successful. The seemingly endless name of cast members also becomes dizzying. Al Pacino (Oscar-nominated) steals every scene and pulls a Jack Nicholson from "Batman" out of his hat. "Dick Tracy" is a good film, but it is far from being a masterpiece. 4 stars out of 5."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":59429,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1990-06-15","keywords":"based on comic strip,detective,police detective,dick tracy,crime boss","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2484649497","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTM0Y2ZmNzUtYzJhYy00OGNlLTljMDUtZWE4N2QyMGU0ZGVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTM0Y2ZmNzUtYzJhYy00OGNlLTljMDUtZWE4N2QyMGU0ZGVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The comic strip detective finds his life vastly complicated when Breathless Mahoney makes advances towards him while he is trying to battle Big Boy Caprice's united mob."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000886/","name":"Warren Beatty"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000187/","name":"Madonna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000886/","name":"Warren Beatty"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0133018/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049348/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0332333/","name":"Chester Gould"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0143596/","name":"Jim Cash"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0258390/","name":"Jack Epps Jr."}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="
